name: Shirley's Maine Clam Chowder
author: IRELAND2
summary: This is a rich clam chowder, but not as thick and pasty as some. Fresh shucked clams are recommended, but you may also use canned clams.
ingredients: 3 large russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
8 slices bacon, cut into small pieces
directions: In a small saucepan, heat clam juice and peeled potatoes
Bring water to a boil and let simmer until tender, about 15 minutes
Place bacon in a large stock pot
Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown
Add potatoes, clam juice and clams to the stock pot
In a separate pot, gently warm (do not boil) half and half
Pour warm half and half into the stock pot and heat just until warmed through
Do not boil the chowder or the cream will separate
